column2: Forestland Management Project
Gapan-San Fernando-Olongapo Road Project, Phase II
column17: Issue on Right-of-Way and Land Acquisition
column18:
Actual accomplishment as of June 2014 is at 88.78% against the 57.85% target or a negative slippage of 30.93%. 

The project continued to experience delays due to ROW problems and complaint of affected lot owner.
column19: NEDA-MES informed NRO III on the inclusion of GSO II in the Alert Mechanism. As a result, a problem solving session (PSS) and an ocular inspection was conducted on 3 September 2014. The agreements during the PSS and ocular inspection include the creation of a Technical Working Group (TWG) to address implementation issues and to establish "Task Force Lipat Poste" for ROW concerns. NEDA-MES is coordinating closely with NRO III on updates on the activities of the TWG.

column2: Greater Modular Access (GMA) RoRo Ports

column18: Incomplete outputs. The project is to be replaced by the  proposed Philippine Port and Coast Guard Capacity Development Project using the remaining balance . The proposed project was aprpoved by ICC in 2013 but approval from the Govt. of France is awaited.
column19: During the ODA Portfolio Review, MES recommended DOTC/PCG to fast-track finalization and implementation of the amended contract for the proposed project once BNP Paribas approval is secured.

column2: Mindanao Roads Improvement Project
column17: DPWH is yet to submit the requisite ICC documents for the processing of its request to re-avail the loan for the rehabiliation of road sections continguous but outside the current scope of the project. It should be noted the ICC-CC, in its 3 July 2012 meeting, approved the DPWH request not to seek a further loan extension beyond 31 Dec 2012. The SFD, however, extended the loan until 11 Oct 2014 despite said ICC decision.
column18: The ICC-CC, in its 3 July 2012 meeting approved the DPWH request not to seek a further loan extension beyond 31 Dec 2012, the SFD, however, extended the loan until 11 Oct 2014 despite said ICC decision.
column19: NEDA informed DPWH that ICC notation/approval will be needed for their intention to re-avail SFD loan.
